text.headline: Municipal Golf in Georgia
text.text:
Warmouth Sands Golf is a new rebuilt 18 hole municipal golf course in Vidalia, Georgia. The course is being designed by Mike Young and will open in 2024. The site is located at the Vidalia Regional Sports Complex on Ezra Taylor Road. The course plays to a par 72 at 7,295 yards from the back tees vs. 5,804 yards from the front tees.

The project is part of the Sweet Onion Golf Authority, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting golf in Vidalia. The course is being funded through a combination of private donations, grants, and tax revenue. Warmouth Sands Golf is expected to be a popular destination for golfers in the Vidalia area. The course is named after the warmouth bream, a small fish that is found in the area. The golf course construction benefits from sandy soil. The course is afforable and open to the public.

Warmouth Sands Golf is located in Toombs County, Georgia. Toombs County is a rural county located in the southeastern corner of Georgia with a population of approximately 25,000 people. The county seat is Vidalia with a population of approximately 15,000 people. Warmouth Sands Golf is the first new golf course to be built in Toombs County in over 20 years.
